ResourceHeader.ResourceName: ISIS-1 Topside Sounder Average Ionogram over Kashima, Japan: KSH, Latitude 36, Longitude 141

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata

Added PublicationInfo. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB
Added MetadataRightsList and RightsList(s). Updated to 2.7.1. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: This Ionogram was digitized from the original ISIS 1 Analog Telemetry Data on 7-Track Tape using the Facilities of the Data Evaluation Laboratory at NASA GSFC, Code 500. This Data Restoration Project is headed by Dr. R.F. Benson, NASA GSFC, Code 692. Ionograms were digitized at the Rate of 40,000 16-bit samples/s. This Sample Rate is higher than the Nyquist Frequency of 30 kHz. The Sample Frequency of 40 kHz provides a Measurement every 25 ms corresponding to an Apparent Range Interval of c*t/2, where c is the Speed of Light, or 3.747 km. Each Ionogram consists of a Fixed Frequency Portion and a Swept Frequency Portion. The Time Resolution is typically 29 s.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: James H. Whitteker, Robert F. Benson, Dieter K. Bilitza. Please thank James H. Whitteker, Principal Investigator for the ISIS 1 Swept Frequency Sounder, SFS, Instrument and Robert F. Benson, Project Scientist for the Alouette/ISIS Data-Restoration

TimeSpan.Note: The Cadence is 31 s between Ionograms. The Alouette 2 Ionograms have the slowest Sweep Rate of any of the Alouette/ISIS Topside Sounders sweeping from 0.12 to 14.5 MHz in about 28 s with a Frequency Sweep Rate of 0.13 MHz/s below 2.0 MHz, providing the highest Frequency Resolution of any of the ISIS Program Sounders. The Alouette 2 Frequency Sweep Rate above 2 MHz was 1 MHz/s. Alouette 2 did not have a Fixed Frequency Operation.

Parameter.Name: Satellite ID
Parameter.Description: Satellite ID: 1=Alouette 1, 2=Alouette 2, 3=ISIS 1, 4=ISIS 2

Parameter.Name: Telemetry Station Code
Parameter.Description: Two-Digit Telemetry Station Code

Parameter.Name: Transmitter Power Code
Parameter.Description: Transmitter Power Code: 1=Primary, 400 W, 2=Secondary, 400 W

Parameter.Name: Sounder-Receiver Code
Parameter.Description: Sounder-Receiver Code: 0=Off, 1=On

Parameter.Name: Pulse per Second Code
Parameter.Description: Pulse per Second Code: 0=30 Pulses/s, 1=60 Pulses/s

Parameter.Name: DMODE Code
Parameter.Description: DMODE, Transmission On/Off for Alternate Frame Pairs: 0=Off, 1=On

Parameter.Name: GMODE Code
Parameter.Description: GMODE, Transmission of Alternate Frames of Fixed Frequency Ionograms and Normal Combined Fixed Frequency and Swept Frequency Ionograms: 0=Off, 1=On

Parameter.Name: Sounder Mixed Mode
Parameter.Description: Sounder Mixed Mode, Transmission at a Fixed Frequency while the Sounder-Receiver sweeps over the Swept Frequency Range: 0=Off, 1=On

Parameter.Name: Fixed Frequency Code
Parameter.Description: Fixed Frequency Code: 0=Off, 1=0.25 MHz, 2=0.48 MHz, 3=1.00 MHz, 4=1.95 MHz, 5=4.00 MHz, 6=9.303 MHz

Parameter.Name: Year
Parameter.Description: Year of Ionogram Frame Sync

Parameter.Name: Day of Year
Parameter.Description: Day of Year of Ionogram Frame Sync

Parameter.Name: Hour of Day
Parameter.Description: Hour of Day of Ionogram Frame Sync, UT

Parameter.Name: Minute of Hour
Parameter.Description: Minute of Hour of Ionogram Frame Sync, UT

Parameter.Name: Second of Minute
Parameter.Description: Second of Minute of Ionogram Frame Sync, UT

Parameter.Name: Local Mean Time
Parameter.Description: Local Mean Time, LMT, at the Time of Ionogram Frame Sync, Format: HH,MM

Parameter.Name: Geographic Coordinates
Parameter.Description: Geographic Coordinates, GEO, Latitude, Longitude, Height, at the Time of Ionogram Frame Sync

Parameter.Name: Geomagnetic Local Time
Parameter.Description: Geomagnetic Local Time, GMLMT, Format: HH,MM, at the Time of Ionogram Frame Sync

Parameter.Name: Geomagnetic Latitude
Parameter.Description: Geomagnetic Latitude, MAG, at the Time of Ionogram Frame Sync

Parameter.Name: Geomagnetic Longitude
Parameter.Description: Geomagnetic Longitude, MAG, at the Time of Ionogram Frame Sync

Parameter.Name: Invariant Latitude
Parameter.Description: Invariant Latitude, at the Time of Ionogram Frame Sync

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Inclination
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Inclination, Dip Angle of Magnetic Field Direction, at the Time of Ionogram Frame Sync

Parameter.Name: Solar Zenith Angle
Parameter.Description: Solar Zenith Angle, SZA, at the Time of Ionogram Frame Sync

Parameter.Name: L Shell
Parameter.Description: L Shell, McIlwain Parameter, at the Time of Ionogram Frame Sync

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Sunlight
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Sunlight: 0=Out, 1=In, at the Time of Ionogram Frame Sync

Parameter.Name: CEP, Instrument Status
Parameter.Description: Cylindrical Electrostatic Probe, CEP, Instrument Status: 0=Off, 1=On

Parameter.Name: VLF, Instrument Status
Parameter.Description: Very Low Frequency, VLF, 0.05 to 30 kHz Receiver, Instrument Status: 0=Off, 1=On

Parameter.Name: SEA, Instrument Status
Parameter.Description: Spherical Electrostatic Analyzer, SEA, Instrument Status: 0=Off, 1=On

Parameter.Name: IMS1, Instrument Status
Parameter.Description: Ion Mass Spectrometer 1, IMS1, Instrument Status: 0=Off, 1=On

Parameter.Name: IMS2, Instrument Status
Parameter.Description: Ion Mass Spectrometer 2, IMS1, Instrument Status: 0=Off, 1=On

Parameter.Name: SPS, Instrument Status
Parameter.Description: Soft Particle Spectrometer, SPS, Instrument Status: 0=Off, 1=On

Parameter.Name: EPD, Instrument Status
Parameter.Description: Energetic Particle Detector, EPD, Instrument Status: 0=Off, 1=On

Parameter.Name: Start of Swept Frequency Portion
Parameter.Description: Scan Line Number of the Start of Swept Frequency Portion of the Ionogram, this seperates the Fixed Frequency and Swept Frequency Portions of the Ionogram
Parameter.Caveats: seperates the fixed and swept portions

Parameter.Name: Times of Ionogram Frequency Markers
Parameter.Description: Times of Ionogram Frequency Markers, Milliseconds after Frame Sync
Parameter.Caveats: time of frequency markers This parameter exhibits an increasing monotonic progression.

Parameter.Name: Values of Ionogram Frequency Markers
Parameter.Description: Ionogram Frequency Marker Valuess

Parameter.Name: Number of Delay Times per Ionogram Scan Line
Parameter.Description: Number of Delay Times per Ionogram Scan Line. Each Sounder Pulse Transmission is followed by a Scan of the Sounder-Receiver Video Amplitude Output Values for each Delay Time monitored after the transmitted Pulse. These Scans are called Scan Lines. There are two Types of ISIS 1 Binary Ionogram Files, one designated as Full and the other designated as Average. The Full File has 1340 Delay Times, one every 0.025 ms. The Average Files are derived from the Full Files by averaging the Amplitude Values in four Delay Time Bins. Thus, the Average Binary Files contain 335 Time Delay Bins within each Scan Line. The CDF Files were made from these Average Binary Files.

Parameter.Name: Number of Ionogram Scan Line Frequencies
Parameter.Description: Number of Ionogram Scan Line Frequencie Steps. Ionogram Files can be of different Lengths. In some the Swept Frequency Portion covers the Range from 0.1 Mhz to 10 MHz, in others from 0.1 Mhz to 20 MHz. Also, the proper Start of each Ionogram File, marked by a Frame Sync Pulse, was not always detected during the Analog to Digital, A/D, Conversion. In such cases, a Frame Sync was inserted to limit the File Size. Thus the Number of Sounder-Receiver Video Amplitude versus Delay Time Scan Lines per Ionogram can vary.

Parameter.Name: Delay Time Values
Parameter.Description: Delay Time Values used in each Scan Line

Parameter.Name: Apparent Range Values
Parameter.Description: Virtual Height Values corresponding to Delay Times used in each Scan Line

Parameter.Name: Epoch Time
Parameter.Description: Epoch Time
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter exhibits an increasing monotonic progression.

Parameter.Name: Sounder Amplitude
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Sounder Amplitude at 335 Virtual Heights for Fixed Frequency and Swept Frequency, Ionogram. The Sounder-Receiver Linear Video Amplitude, from 0 to 255 Telemetry Units, in each Apparent Range Bin of each Scan Line covering the Fixed Frequency and Swept Frequency Regions. This Range corresponds to a Linear Sounder-Receiver Video Amplitude Output Range from 0 V to 4.5 V. This Calibration is based on the Video Calibration Pulse, of 3.0 V or 170 Telemetry Units, at the End of the Line Scan following each Sounder Pulse. The Combined Calibration Pulses from all of the Line Scans produces a Colored Stripe at the Bottom of the Digital Ionograms. In order to derive an Input Power Level corresponding to the Receiver Video Output, it is necessary to know the Sounder-Receiver Automatic Gain Control, AGC, Voltage. This Voltage was obtained from the Pulse Code Modulation, PCM, Data and thus is only available if PCM Data were available. The AGC Voltage, which ranges from 0 V to 5.12 V, is obtained from a Linear Interpolation between the AGC Trace displayed between the 4005 km Apparent Range, at 26.7 ms Delay Time, as 5.12 V and the 4395 km, at 29.3 ms Delay Time, as 0 V. On the Full Ionograms these Numbers are 4001.250 km or 26.675 ms and 4398.750 km or 29.325 ms. On the Average Ionograms, which are available as either CDF or Binary Files from the SPDF or the NSSDC, the Range Resolution is 0.1 ms, corresponding to a Virtual Range Resolution of 15 km. There are 27 Rows an thus 26 Intervals covering the 0 V to 5.12 V Range; thus each Row in Virtual Range above, i.e. decreasing Delay Time, the Zero Level at 29.3 ms Delay Time corresponds to an Increase of 5.12/26 V of AGC with a Quantization Uncertainty of approximately Plus or Minus 0.1 V. Two Rows have Zero Video Output Amplitude Values on the Average Ionograms in order that a clear AGC Trace is visible on the Ionograms. The Row with the greatest Virtual Range corresponds to the actual AGC Value. On the Full Ionograms, which are only available as Binary Files from the NSSDC, the Range Resolution is 0.025 ms, corresponding to a Virtual Range Resolution of 3.75 km, and three Rows have Zero Video Output Amplitude Values; the middle Row corresponds to the actual AGC Value.

Parameter.Name: Interpolated Frequencies
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Interpolated Fixed and Swept Frequencies for each Scan Line, in the Swept Frequency Portion of the Ionogram they correspond to interpolated Values between the Frequency Markers
Parameter.Caveats: This variable could be used as x-axis on amplitude spectrograms if fixed part is subtracted.

Parameter.Name: Height
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Satellite Altitude
Parameter.Caveats: Virtual variable. This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function HEIGHT_ISIS with the following input parameters: geo_coord.

Parameter.Name: Electron Local Gyrofrequency
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Electron Local Gyrofrequency, at the Time of Ionogram Frame Sync
